structured_data.overview: This content describes planning applications and permits for the City of El Segundo, including information about the approval process, temporary use permits, entertainment permits, and various application types.

forms.name: Temporary Use Permit (TUP)
forms.purpose: To allow a Temporary Outdoor Use such as a Parking Lot Sale, Employee Event, Dedication and Ceremonial Event on Private Property
requirements: PDF and JPG file formats for attachments

forms.name: Entertainment Permit
forms.purpose: Required for any premises allowing entertainment including dancing
requirements: Expires December 31 of the year of issuance

signup_info.description: Register and apply for permits through the El Segundo E-Z Permit Hub
requirements: Electronic submission of applications, plans, and documents in PDF or JPG format
benefits: Single place for all applications, plan submittals, fee payments, reviews, permit issuance, inspection requests, and communication with City staff

permits_licenses.description: For temporary outdoor uses such as parking lot sales, employee events, dedications, and ceremonial events on private property
requirements: Online application through E-Z Permit Hub

permits_licenses.description: Required for premises allowing entertainment including dancing
requirements: Permits issued after October 31 expire December 31 of the next year
Not required for city property use unless leased for more than 7 consecutive days

structured_data.other_info: The Planning Commission consists of five residents appointed by the City Council to review matters such as Use Permits, Variances, and higher-level planning and zoning decisions. The city offers numerous application guides for different types of permits and applications, including adjustment applications, use permits, appeals, development agreements, and more. There is also a fee schedule for applications including parking in-lieu fees and development impact fees.
